commits.message:
Tests should not depend on the system locale (#744)

One of the tests was using locale specific number formatting, and
broke the test when running in a system that is not using a comma as a
thousands separator.

issue.title: renderMenuItemChildren's type is too generic
issue.body:
The `renderMenuItemChildren` property's type is `(option: Option, ...) => JSX.Element`, with `Option` defined as `string | Record<string, any>`. This means that implementors of `renderMenuItemChildren` need to handle both a `string` and a `Record<string, any>` (by casting onto the right type).

However, the actual type of "Option" should be inferred from the type of the `options` parameters.

Pull request forthcoming.

comment.body: @HansAarneLiblik: I'm not sure, do you want to give it a shot? The main problem described in the thread is that to truly propagate the generic type basically involves passing it through the entire codebase. If you have a solution that avoids that, then it might be feasible.

issue.title: Option to disable showing first element in blurred text in case of exact match
issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for using react-bootstrap-typeahead and for taking the time to request a feature!

Usage questions
======================
Unless you believe you've encountered a bug or want to request a feature, the issue tracker isn't the right place for getting help with your code. This format is not well-suited for Q&A, and questions here don't have as much visibility as they do elsewhere. Before you ask a question, here are some resources to get help first:

- Read the docs: https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/tree/master/docs
- Try the examples: http://ericgio.github.io/react-bootstrap-typeahead/
- Look for/ask questions on StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=react-bootstrap-typeahead
-->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
yes. I want an option to not show the first element in blurred text in case of exact match

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The requirement is to not show the blurred text. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/108060133/196632289-8ea3d579-f7fa-4591-9424-06d11dbe2e35.png)

The actual issue is that, when we click on tab, the blurred text(or the first item) is getting selected. We want to restrict to select the first item when we press tab key

**How is this solution useful to others?**
This would restrict the first item getting selected

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
We tried to control tab key behavior on onKeyDown but didn't get the desired result.

issue.title: Type errors when using typescript in v6.0.0
issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for using react-bootstrap-typeahead and for reporting an issue! To submit a bug report, please fill out the template below. Better yet, submit a pull request that introduces a failing test due to the bug :)

Do not simply delete this template or your issue will be closed. Issues without required information will be closed.

Usage questions
======================
Unless you believe you've encountered a bug or want to request a feature, the issue tracker isn't the right place for getting help with your code. This format is not well-suited for Q&A, and questions here don't have as much visibility as they do elsewhere. Before you ask a question, here are some resources to get help first:

- Read the docs: https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/tree/master/docs
- Try the examples: http://ericgio.github.io/react-bootstrap-typeahead/
- Look for/ask questions on StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=react-bootstrap-typeahead
-->
### Version
6.0.0

<!-- Be sure to double-check your installed version, as it may differ from the version listed in your package.json -->

### Description
When I updated my typescript project to use v6.0.0, there are errors appearing because the generic type of the `Option` that the `AsyncTypeahead` and `Typeahead` components use has been removed. When I remove the generic argument in my code, I get errors in my code because the types of Typeahead’s `Option` type don’t match my object.

I think the use of the generic type on AsyncTypeahead and Typeahead that was in the DefinitelyTyped types for the v5 version was exactly the right way to do this and it would be great if that was reinstated. This would also ease the upgrade path for typescript projects.

I have put together a codesandbox example that shows the error:

https://codesandbox.io/s/pensive-antonelli-o84wbj?file=/src/index.tsx

In my project, I’m getting errors on the `labelKey` prop as well. I’m not sure why that’s not showing in my example.

### Expected Behavior

It shouldn’t be necessary to bypass the typing system on the `onChange` prop to get the code to build cleanly.

### Actual Behavior

I get this error:
```
Type 'Dispatch<SetStateAction<StateStat[]>>' is not assignable to type '(selected: Option[]) => void'.
  Types of parameters 'value' and 'selected' are incompatible.
    Type 'Option[]' is not assignable to type 'SetStateAction<StateStat[]>'.
      Type 'Option[]' is not assignable to type 'StateStat[]'.
        Type 'Option' is not assignable to type 'StateStat'.
          Type 'string' is not assignable to type 'StateStat'.ts(2322)
```

comment.body:
> Is it worth contacting the people who did the DefinitelyTyped definitions? They did a really great job there

I've taken a look at the DT types and while they did do a nice job, one of the key differences is that they're only declaring types for the public API. To truly type this library in a comprehensive way, I'd also need to propagate types (specifically option generics) throughout the private API, which is significant.

I'm definitely open to ideas for how to provide type flexibility without significantly impacting the maintainability of the library.

issue.title: Support Multiple Datasets
issue.body:
Hello there, first of all thanks for your effort into writing react-bootstrap-typeahead.

I'm assigned a task at work to migrate a search component that uses the original jQuery based typeahead to react-bootstrap-typeahead. This search component queries multiple datasets. When the user types on the input, it queries different services and, if there are results, shows then grouped:

![multiple results](https://i.stack.imgur.com/FeSns.png)

(in this example, user typed "b", and there are results both from Addresses and Previous Results data sources)

The generated HTML by original typeahead in this example is as follows:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/397851/194612591-c41d2bbc-d6dc-46b1-a4db-55acc150a5f8.png)

Notice other databases were queried but their result is empty.

Something like this is not possible like this at this moment, right? I'm thinking of an ugly workaround (i.e. making multiple queries on `handleSearch`, concatenate the results and inserting fake, dummy elements to create the titles) but I'm not sure that this would be the best approach.

issue.title: Support Multiple Datasets
issue.body:
Hello there, first of all thanks for your effort into writing react-bootstrap-typeahead.

I'm assigned a task at work to migrate a search component that uses the original jQuery based typeahead to react-bootstrap-typeahead. This search component queries multiple datasets. When the user types on the input, it queries different services and, if there are results, shows then grouped:

![multiple results](https://i.stack.imgur.com/FeSns.png)

(in this example, user typed "b", and there are results both from Addresses and Previous Results data sources)

The generated HTML by original typeahead in this example is as follows:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/397851/194612591-c41d2bbc-d6dc-46b1-a4db-55acc150a5f8.png)

Notice other databases were queried but their result is empty.

Something like this is not possible like this at this moment, right? I'm thinking of an ugly workaround (i.e. making multiple queries on `handleSearch`, concatenate the results and inserting fake, dummy elements to create the titles) but I'm not sure that this would be the best approach.

comment.body:
Hey @nighto, thanks for opening this issue. I've [answered your question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/73990255/multiple-datasets-grouping-with-react-bootstrap-typeahead) about grouping the results over on StackOverflow.

As far as handling multiple datasets, it's entirely possible. The typeahead component doesn't care where data comes from, as long as it's ultimately passed in as a single array to the `options` prop. You could query multiple sources from `onSearch`, like a local cache as well as a remote endpoint.

issue.title: Confirmation of the choice on the tablet
issue.body:
On the keyboard, you can type a value in the input field. And if it starts to match the desired value, you can confirm the selection by pressing the "right-arrow" key.

Isn't there a similar action for quick selection for a mobile device? Thanks

issue.title: Confirmation of the choice on the tablet
issue.body:
On the keyboard, you can type a value in the input field. And if it starts to match the desired value, you can confirm the selection by pressing the "right-arrow" key.

Isn't there a similar action for quick selection for a mobile device? Thanks

comment.body:
> a similar action for quick selection for a mobile device?

You can use the [`selectHint` prop](https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/blob/main/docs/Upgrading.md#shouldselecthint-replaced-by-top-level-selecthint) to customize the hint selection behavior.

> is there an automatic selection option, if you paste into a field from the clipboard and there is one matching value in the list?

You can probably add an `onPaste` handler directly to the input and check the value against the options being passed to the typeahead. If one of the matches you can set the selection in state and pass the value to the `selected` prop.

-->
### Version
6.0.0

<!-- Be sure to double-check your installed version, as it may differ from the version listed in your package.json -->

### Description
When I updated my typescript project to use v6.0.0, there are errors appearing because the generic type of the `Option` that the `AsyncTypeahead` and `Typeahead` components use has been removed. When I remove the generic argument in my code, I get errors in my code because the types of Typeahead’s `Option` type don’t match my object.

I think the use of the generic type on AsyncTypeahead and Typeahead that was in the DefinitelyTyped types for the v5 version was exactly the right way to do this and it would be great if that was reinstated. This would also ease the upgrade path for typescript projects.

I have put together a codesandbox example that shows the error:

https://codesandbox.io/s/pensive-antonelli-o84wbj?file=/src/index.tsx

In my project, I’m getting errors on the `labelKey` prop as well. I’m not sure why that’s not showing in my example.

### Expected Behavior

It shouldn’t be necessary to bypass the typing system on the `onChange` prop to get the code to build cleanly.

### Actual Behavior

I get this error:
```
Type 'Dispatch<SetStateAction<StateStat[]>>' is not assignable to type '(selected: Option[]) => void'.
  Types of parameters 'value' and 'selected' are incompatible.
    Type 'Option[]' is not assignable to type 'SetStateAction<StateStat[]>'.
      Type 'Option[]' is not assignable to type 'StateStat[]'.
        Type 'Option' is not assignable to type 'StateStat'.
          Type 'string' is not assignable to type 'StateStat'.ts(2322)
```

comment.body: Yeah as I alluded, it's a bit of a workaround. There's a bit more detail in the original issue, but truly fixing this problem with generics is pretty involved and has its own tradeoffs.

comment.body:
I believe this is a duplicate of #704.

You should be able to type the argument of `onChange` to get around this:

```tsx
<Typeahead
  ...
  onChange={(selected: StateStat[]) => setSelected(selected)}
/>
```

comment.body: It seems to be a conflict with some package in `/usr/local/bin`. The `nvm` commands work fine after removing that from `$PATH`. It seems like something got copied over in the migration and mucked things up. Thanks for the help, I think we can consider the issue closed.

issue.title: AsyncTypeahead and searchText programatically
AsyncTypeahead and searchText programatically

comment.body:
The async functionality is primarily meant to work with user input, since it debounces the input. It seems like you should be able to trigger your search function using `onMenuToggle` as you're doing. You can pass a different string to the `emptyLabel` prop to indicate that the request is in progress.

You may want to consider looking at the [async behavior](https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/blob/main/src/behaviors/async.tsx) and writing your own version, since it sounds like you have some specific use cases you're trying to address.

issue.title: Support Bootstrap 5
issue.body:
[Bootstrap 5](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/getting-started/introduction/) is currently in beta, so I'm creating this issue to track the changes this library will need to make to support the new version out of the box. Please comment if you come across anything not working.

- [x] Update `ClearButton` classname to include `btn-close` ([BS5 Close Button component](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/components/close-button/))
- [x] Rename `sr-only` classname to `visually-hidden` ([Helpers](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/migration/#helpers))
- [x] Support [floating labels](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/forms/floating-labels/)

As a general workaround, the typeahead's [render props](https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/blob/master/docs/Rendering.md) and [child render function](https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/blob/master/docs/API.md#children) can be used to customize individual components in a way that better supports BS5.

release.name: v6.0.0
release.body:
### Breaking Changes

Please see the [migration guide](https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/blob/master/docs/Upgrading.md#v60-breaking-changes) for more details on breaking changes and how to upgrade from v5 to v6.

- Drop support for IE11
- Upgrade react-popper/popperjs to v2 (#549)
- Don't allow refs to be passed via `inputProps`
- Introduced `selectHint` as a top-level prop; removed `shouldSelectHint` from lower-level components.
- Remove `selectHintOnEnter` prop
- Remove `asyncContainer`, `menutItemContainer`, and `tokenContainer` functions
- Removed `'large'` and `'small'` as valid values from the `size` prop

### Feature Requests
- Convert library to Typescript (#619)
- Support Bootstrap 5
- Allow better control of multi-select placeholder (#684)

### Bug Fixes
- Fix aux controls overlapping with validation (#658)
- Strip diacritics from non-latin alphabets (#659, #660)
- Only fire `onFocus` event once (#665)
- Trigger change handler when clicking clear button in multi-select mode (#666, #672)
- Get rid of console warnings in examples
- Ignore helper file from test coverage
- Fix act warnings in tests
- Don't pass option object to token
- Fix click forwarding on multi-select input (#695)
- Fix filter callback return type (#702) (Thanks @povder!)
- Remove @emotion/core types after running yarn (#705) (Thanks @DASPRiD!)
- Fix bug when filtering with `labelKey` function (#714)
- Fix multi-input disabled styles (#718)
- Copy font-weight to hintNode (#719)
- Upgrade react-overlays (#717, #721) (Thanks @charlesroelli!)

### Internal + Documentation
- Replace Travis w/Github Actions
- Use Prettier
- Incorporate Storybook and add Chromatic integration
- Upgrade dependencies
- Use `key` instead of `keyCode` for keyboard events
- Convert `Highlighter` to function component
- Add instructions for BS5 CSS
- Added breaking changes to the migration guide
- Added Storybook stories for each component
- Updated Jest config/setup
- Use rem for CSS
- Convert `withClassNames` HoC to a simple function
- Use `sass.compile` instead of `sass.render`
- Remove rollup-plugin-size-snapshot
- Use PrismJS as a module
- Add invariant types
- Convert examples to TS
- Add example for keeping the menu open during multi-selection

Do not simply delete this template or your issue will be closed. Issues without required information will be closed.

### Version
v6.0.0-rc3

<!-- Be sure to double-check your installed version, as it may differ from the version listed in your package.json -->

### Steps to reproduce

<!--
Please provide DETAILED steps or better yet, a minimal repro case. If I can't reproduce the problem based on the information you provide, your issue will be closed.

Starter sandbox: https://codesandbox.io/s/9jq9jyzmry
-->
In version v5 I was able to import `defaultFilterBy` method from the library with
```
import { defaultFilterBy } from "react-bootstrap-typeahead/lib/utils"
```
To create a wrapped version of it and minimize code repetition e.g.
```
export function filterByCer(option, props) {
  const text = someTextNormalization(props.text)
  const _props = {
    ...props,
    ...{
      filterBy: [props.labelKey],
      text: text
    }
  }
  return defaultFilterBy(option, _props)
}
```
Starting from v6 this method is not exported anymore forcing me to copy the logic

### Expected Behavior

<!-- Describe what you would have expected. -->
Being able to import `defaultFilterBy`

### Actual Behavior

<!-- Describe what went wrong. -->

comment.body:
The `lib/` directory was renamed to `cjs/` in v6.0.0-alpha.3, so you can still access `defaultFilterBy` from 

```tsx
import { defaultFilterBy } from "react-bootstrap-typeahead/cjs/utils"
```
or
```tsx
import { defaultFilterBy } from "react-bootstrap-typeahead/es/utils"
```

Note that `defaultFilterBy` is not a top-level export of the library and should be considered private. It's therefore probably better that you do copy the functionality into your own codebase.

comment.body: @saivivek116 that's right, using the `clear` method won't work for multi-select instances since it will clear the selections as well as the text. Unfortunately, there's also no API for controlling the input's value (#266). One workaround would be to save the selections using state, and update the typeahead's react key on blur. This would maintain the selections but cause the component to unmount and remount, clearing the text.

comment.body: Hi @architdutt, and thanks for the feature request! The highlighting you refer to happens within the `Highlighter` component included in this library. That component currently doesn't provide a way to limit the substring match to the beginning of the string, but it should be pretty easy to [create your own component](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29652862/highlight-text-using-reactjs). Once you've done that, you can use `renderMenu` or `renderMenuItemChildren` to render the menu items using your component.

issue.title: renderMenuItemChildren's type is too generic
issue.body:
The `renderMenuItemChildren` property's type is `(option: Option, ...) => JSX.Element`, with `Option` defined as `string | Record<string, any>`. This means that implementors of `renderMenuItemChildren` need to handle both a `string` and a `Record<string, any>` (by casting onto the right type).

However, the actual type of "Option" should be inferred from the type of the `options` parameters.

Pull request forthcoming.

comment.body: @HansAarneLiblik: I'm not sure, do you want to give it a shot? The main problem described in the thread is that to truly propagate the generic type basically involves passing it through the entire codebase. If you have a solution that avoids that, then it might be feasible.

issue.title: Option to disable showing first element in blurred text in case of exact match
issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for using react-bootstrap-typeahead and for taking the time to request a feature!

Usage questions
======================
Unless you believe you've encountered a bug or want to request a feature, the issue tracker isn't the right place for getting help with your code. This format is not well-suited for Q&A, and questions here don't have as much visibility as they do elsewhere. Before you ask a question, here are some resources to get help first:

- Read the docs: https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/tree/master/docs
- Try the examples: http://ericgio.github.io/react-bootstrap-typeahead/
- Look for/ask questions on StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=react-bootstrap-typeahead
-->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
yes. I want an option to not show the first element in blurred text in case of exact match

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The requirement is to not show the blurred text. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/108060133/196632289-8ea3d579-f7fa-4591-9424-06d11dbe2e35.png)

The actual issue is that, when we click on tab, the blurred text(or the first item) is getting selected. We want to restrict to select the first item when we press tab key

**How is this solution useful to others?**
This would restrict the first item getting selected

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
We tried to control tab key behavior on onKeyDown but didn't get the desired result.

issue.title: Type errors when using typescript in v6.0.0
issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for using react-bootstrap-typeahead and for reporting an issue! To submit a bug report, please fill out the template below. Better yet, submit a pull request that introduces a failing test due to the bug :)

Do not simply delete this template or your issue will be closed. Issues without required information will be closed.

Usage questions
======================
Unless you believe you've encountered a bug or want to request a feature, the issue tracker isn't the right place for getting help with your code. This format is not well-suited for Q&A, and questions here don't have as much visibility as they do elsewhere. Before you ask a question, here are some resources to get help first:

- Read the docs: https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/tree/master/docs
- Try the examples: http://ericgio.github.io/react-bootstrap-typeahead/
- Look for/ask questions on StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=react-bootstrap-typeahead
-->
### Version
6.0.0

<!-- Be sure to double-check your installed version, as it may differ from the version listed in your package.json -->

### Description
When I updated my typescript project to use v6.0.0, there are errors appearing because the generic type of the `Option` that the `AsyncTypeahead` and `Typeahead` components use has been removed. When I remove the generic argument in my code, I get errors in my code because the types of Typeahead’s `Option` type don’t match my object.

I think the use of the generic type on AsyncTypeahead and Typeahead that was in the DefinitelyTyped types for the v5 version was exactly the right way to do this and it would be great if that was reinstated. This would also ease the upgrade path for typescript projects.

I have put together a codesandbox example that shows the error:

https://codesandbox.io/s/pensive-antonelli-o84wbj?file=/src/index.tsx

In my project, I’m getting errors on the `labelKey` prop as well. I’m not sure why that’s not showing in my example.

### Expected Behavior

It shouldn’t be necessary to bypass the typing system on the `onChange` prop to get the code to build cleanly.

### Actual Behavior

I get this error:
```
Type 'Dispatch<SetStateAction<StateStat[]>>' is not assignable to type '(selected: Option[]) => void'.
  Types of parameters 'value' and 'selected' are incompatible.
    Type 'Option[]' is not assignable to type 'SetStateAction<StateStat[]>'.
      Type 'Option[]' is not assignable to type 'StateStat[]'.
        Type 'Option' is not assignable to type 'StateStat'.
          Type 'string' is not assignable to type 'StateStat'.ts(2322)
```

comment.body:
> Is it worth contacting the people who did the DefinitelyTyped definitions? They did a really great job there

I've taken a look at the DT types and while they did do a nice job, one of the key differences is that they're only declaring types for the public API. To truly type this library in a comprehensive way, I'd also need to propagate types (specifically option generics) throughout the private API, which is significant.

I'm definitely open to ideas for how to provide type flexibility without significantly impacting the maintainability of the library.

issue.title: Support Multiple Datasets
issue.body:
Hello there, first of all thanks for your effort into writing react-bootstrap-typeahead.

I'm assigned a task at work to migrate a search component that uses the original jQuery based typeahead to react-bootstrap-typeahead. This search component queries multiple datasets. When the user types on the input, it queries different services and, if there are results, shows then grouped:

![multiple results](https://i.stack.imgur.com/FeSns.png)

(in this example, user typed "b", and there are results both from Addresses and Previous Results data sources)

The generated HTML by original typeahead in this example is as follows:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/397851/194612591-c41d2bbc-d6dc-46b1-a4db-55acc150a5f8.png)

Notice other databases were queried but their result is empty.

Something like this is not possible like this at this moment, right? I'm thinking of an ugly workaround (i.e. making multiple queries on `handleSearch`, concatenate the results and inserting fake, dummy elements to create the titles) but I'm not sure that this would be the best approach.

issue.title: Support Multiple Datasets
issue.body:
Hello there, first of all thanks for your effort into writing react-bootstrap-typeahead.

I'm assigned a task at work to migrate a search component that uses the original jQuery based typeahead to react-bootstrap-typeahead. This search component queries multiple datasets. When the user types on the input, it queries different services and, if there are results, shows then grouped:

![multiple results](https://i.stack.imgur.com/FeSns.png)

(in this example, user typed "b", and there are results both from Addresses and Previous Results data sources)

The generated HTML by original typeahead in this example is as follows:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/397851/194612591-c41d2bbc-d6dc-46b1-a4db-55acc150a5f8.png)

Notice other databases were queried but their result is empty.

Something like this is not possible like this at this moment, right? I'm thinking of an ugly workaround (i.e. making multiple queries on `handleSearch`, concatenate the results and inserting fake, dummy elements to create the titles) but I'm not sure that this would be the best approach.

comment.body:
Hey @nighto, thanks for opening this issue. I've [answered your question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/73990255/multiple-datasets-grouping-with-react-bootstrap-typeahead) about grouping the results over on StackOverflow.

As far as handling multiple datasets, it's entirely possible. The typeahead component doesn't care where data comes from, as long as it's ultimately passed in as a single array to the `options` prop. You could query multiple sources from `onSearch`, like a local cache as well as a remote endpoint.

issue.title: Confirmation of the choice on the tablet
issue.body:
On the keyboard, you can type a value in the input field. And if it starts to match the desired value, you can confirm the selection by pressing the "right-arrow" key.

Isn't there a similar action for quick selection for a mobile device? Thanks

issue.title: Confirmation of the choice on the tablet
issue.body:
On the keyboard, you can type a value in the input field. And if it starts to match the desired value, you can confirm the selection by pressing the "right-arrow" key.

Isn't there a similar action for quick selection for a mobile device? Thanks

comment.body:
> a similar action for quick selection for a mobile device?

You can use the [`selectHint` prop](https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/blob/main/docs/Upgrading.md#shouldselecthint-replaced-by-top-level-selecthint) to customize the hint selection behavior.

> is there an automatic selection option, if you paste into a field from the clipboard and there is one matching value in the list?

You can probably add an `onPaste` handler directly to the input and check the value against the options being passed to the typeahead. If one of the matches you can set the selection in state and pass the value to the `selected` prop.

### Version
6.0.0

<!-- Be sure to double-check your installed version, as it may differ from the version listed in your package.json -->

### Description
When I updated my typescript project to use v6.0.0, there are errors appearing because the generic type of the `Option` that the `AsyncTypeahead` and `Typeahead` components use has been removed. When I remove the generic argument in my code, I get errors in my code because the types of Typeahead’s `Option` type don’t match my object.

I think the use of the generic type on AsyncTypeahead and Typeahead that was in the DefinitelyTyped types for the v5 version was exactly the right way to do this and it would be great if that was reinstated. This would also ease the upgrade path for typescript projects.

I have put together a codesandbox example that shows the error:

https://codesandbox.io/s/pensive-antonelli-o84wbj?file=/src/index.tsx

In my project, I’m getting errors on the `labelKey` prop as well. I’m not sure why that’s not showing in my example.

### Expected Behavior

It shouldn’t be necessary to bypass the typing system on the `onChange` prop to get the code to build cleanly.

### Actual Behavior

I get this error:
```
Type 'Dispatch<SetStateAction<StateStat[]>>' is not assignable to type '(selected: Option[]) => void'.
  Types of parameters 'value' and 'selected' are incompatible.
    Type 'Option[]' is not assignable to type 'SetStateAction<StateStat[]>'.
      Type 'Option[]' is not assignable to type 'StateStat[]'.
        Type 'Option' is not assignable to type 'StateStat'.
          Type 'string' is not assignable to type 'StateStat'.ts(2322)
```

comment.body: Yeah as I alluded, it's a bit of a workaround. There's a bit more detail in the original issue, but truly fixing this problem with generics is pretty involved and has its own tradeoffs.

comment.body:
I believe this is a duplicate of #704.

You should be able to type the argument of `onChange` to get around this:

```tsx
<Typeahead
  ...
  onChange={(selected: StateStat[]) => setSelected(selected)}
/>
```

issue.title: AsyncTypeahead and searchText programatically
AsyncTypeahead and searchText programatically

comment.body:
The async functionality is primarily meant to work with user input, since it debounces the input. It seems like you should be able to trigger your search function using `onMenuToggle` as you're doing. You can pass a different string to the `emptyLabel` prop to indicate that the request is in progress.

You may want to consider looking at the [async behavior](https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/blob/main/src/behaviors/async.tsx) and writing your own version, since it sounds like you have some specific use cases you're trying to address.

issue.title: Support Bootstrap 5
issue.body:
[Bootstrap 5](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/getting-started/introduction/) is currently in beta, so I'm creating this issue to track the changes this library will need to make to support the new version out of the box. Please comment if you come across anything not working.

- [x] Update `ClearButton` classname to include `btn-close` ([BS5 Close Button component](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/components/close-button/))
- [x] Rename `sr-only` classname to `visually-hidden` ([Helpers](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/migration/#helpers))
- [x] Support [floating labels](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/forms/floating-labels/)

As a general workaround, the typeahead's [render props](https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/blob/master/docs/Rendering.md) and [child render function](https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/blob/master/docs/API.md#children) can be used to customize individual components in a way that better supports BS5.

release.name: v6.0.0
release.body:
### Breaking Changes

Please see the [migration guide](https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/blob/master/docs/Upgrading.md#v60-breaking-changes) for more details on breaking changes and how to upgrade from v5 to v6.

- Drop support for IE11
- Upgrade react-popper/popperjs to v2 (#549)
- Don't allow refs to be passed via `inputProps`
- Introduced `selectHint` as a top-level prop; removed `shouldSelectHint` from lower-level components.
- Remove `selectHintOnEnter` prop
- Remove `asyncContainer`, `menutItemContainer`, and `tokenContainer` functions
- Removed `'large'` and `'small'` as valid values from the `size` prop

### Feature Requests
- Convert library to Typescript (#619)
- Support Bootstrap 5
- Allow better control of multi-select placeholder (#684)

### Bug Fixes
- Fix aux controls overlapping with validation (#658)
- Strip diacritics from non-latin alphabets (#659, #660)
- Only fire `onFocus` event once (#665)
- Trigger change handler when clicking clear button in multi-select mode (#666, #672)
- Get rid of console warnings in examples
- Ignore helper file from test coverage
- Fix act warnings in tests
- Don't pass option object to token
- Fix click forwarding on multi-select input (#695)
- Fix filter callback return type (#702) (Thanks @povder!)
- Remove @emotion/core types after running yarn (#705) (Thanks @DASPRiD!)
- Fix bug when filtering with `labelKey` function (#714)
- Fix multi-input disabled styles (#718)
- Copy font-weight to hintNode (#719)
- Upgrade react-overlays (#717, #721) (Thanks @charlesroelli!)

### Internal + Documentation
- Replace Travis w/Github Actions
- Use Prettier
- Incorporate Storybook and add Chromatic integration
- Upgrade dependencies
- Use `key` instead of `keyCode` for keyboard events
- Convert `Highlighter` to function component
- Add instructions for BS5 CSS
- Added breaking changes to the migration guide
- Added Storybook stories for each component
- Updated Jest config/setup
- Use rem for CSS
- Convert `withClassNames` HoC to a simple function
- Use `sass.compile` instead of `sass.render`
- Remove rollup-plugin-size-snapshot
- Use PrismJS as a module
- Add invariant types
- Convert examples to TS
- Add example for keeping the menu open during multi-selection

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for using react-bootstrap-typeahead and for reporting an issue! To submit a bug report, please fill out the template below. Better yet, submit a pull request that introduces a failing test due to the bug :)

Do not simply delete this template or your issue will be closed. Issues without required information will be closed.

Usage questions
======================
Unless you believe you've encountered a bug or want to request a feature, the issue tracker isn't the right place for getting help with your code. This format is not well-suited for Q&A, and questions here don't have as much visibility as they do elsewhere. Before you ask a question, here are some resources to get help first:

- Look for/ask questions on StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=react-bootstrap-typeahead

### Version
v6.0.0-rc3

<!-- Be sure to double-check your installed version, as it may differ from the version listed in your package.json -->

### Steps to reproduce

<!--
Please provide DETAILED steps or better yet, a minimal repro case. If I can't reproduce the problem based on the information you provide, your issue will be closed.

Starter sandbox: https://codesandbox.io/s/9jq9jyzmry
-->
In version v5 I was able to import `defaultFilterBy` method from the library with
```
import { defaultFilterBy } from "react-bootstrap-typeahead/lib/utils"
```
To create a wrapped version of it and minimize code repetition e.g.
```
export function filterByCer(option, props) {
  const text = someTextNormalization(props.text)
  const _props = {
    ...props,
    ...{
      filterBy: [props.labelKey],
      text: text
    }
  }
  return defaultFilterBy(option, _props)
}
```
Starting from v6 this method is not exported anymore forcing me to copy the logic

### Expected Behavior

<!-- Describe what you would have expected. -->
Being able to import `defaultFilterBy`

### Actual Behavior

<!-- Describe what went wrong. -->

comment.body:
The `lib/` directory was renamed to `cjs/` in v6.0.0-alpha.3, so you can still access `defaultFilterBy` from 

```tsx
import { defaultFilterBy } from "react-bootstrap-typeahead/cjs/utils"
```
or
```tsx
import { defaultFilterBy } from "react-bootstrap-typeahead/es/utils"
```

Note that `defaultFilterBy` is not a top-level export of the library and should be considered private. It's therefore probably better that you do copy the functionality into your own codebase.

comment.body: @saivivek116 that's right, using the `clear` method won't work for multi-select instances since it will clear the selections as well as the text. Unfortunately, there's also no API for controlling the input's value (#266). One workaround would be to save the selections using state, and update the typeahead's react key on blur. This would maintain the selections but cause the component to unmount and remount, clearing the text.

comment.body: Hi @architdutt, and thanks for the feature request! The highlighting you refer to happens within the `Highlighter` component included in this library. That component currently doesn't provide a way to limit the substring match to the beginning of the string, but it should be pretty easy to [create your own component](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29652862/highlight-text-using-reactjs). Once you've done that, you can use `renderMenu` or `renderMenuItemChildren` to render the menu items using your component.

issue.title: renderMenuItemChildren's type is too generic
issue.body:
The `renderMenuItemChildren` property's type is `(option: Option, ...) => JSX.Element`, with `Option` defined as `string | Record<string, any>`. This means that implementors of `renderMenuItemChildren` need to handle both a `string` and a `Record<string, any>` (by casting onto the right type).

However, the actual type of "Option" should be inferred from the type of the `options` parameters.

Pull request forthcoming.

comment.body: @HansAarneLiblik: I'm not sure, do you want to give it a shot? The main problem described in the thread is that to truly propagate the generic type basically involves passing it through the entire codebase. If you have a solution that avoids that, then it might be feasible.

issue.title: Option to disable showing first element in blurred text in case of exact match
issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for using react-bootstrap-typeahead and for taking the time to request a feature!

Usage questions
======================
Unless you believe you've encountered a bug or want to request a feature, the issue tracker isn't the right place for getting help with your code. -->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
yes. I want an option to not show the first element in blurred text in case of exact match

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The requirement is to not show the blurred text. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/108060133/196632289-8ea3d579-f7fa-4591-9424-06d11dbe2e35.png)

The actual issue is that, when we click on tab, the blurred text(or the first item) is getting selected. We want to restrict to select the first item when we press tab key

**How is this solution useful to others?**
This would restrict the first item getting selected

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
We tried to control tab key behavior on onKeyDown but didn't get the desired result.

issue.title: Type errors when using typescript in v6.0.0
issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for using react-bootstrap-typeahead and for reporting an issue! To submit a bug report, please fill out the template below. Better yet, submit a pull request that introduces a failing test due to the bug :)

Do not simply delete this template or your issue will be closed. Issues without required information will be closed.

Usage questions
======================
Unless you believe you've encountered a bug or want to request a feature, the issue tracker isn't the right place for getting help with your code. This format is not well-suited for Q&A, and questions here don't have as much visibility as they do elsewhere. Before you ask a question, here are some resources to get help first:

- Read the docs: https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/tree/master/docs
- Try the examples: http://ericgio.github.io/react-bootstrap-typeahead/
- Look for/ask questions on StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=react-bootstrap-typeahead
-->
### Version
6.0.0

<!-- Be sure to double-check your installed version, as it may differ from the version listed in your package.json -->

### Description
When I updated my typescript project to use v6.0.0, there are errors appearing because the generic type of the `Option` that the `AsyncTypeahead` and `Typeahead` components use has been removed. When I remove the generic argument in my code, I get errors in my code because the types of Typeahead’s `Option` type don’t match my object.

I think the use of the generic type on AsyncTypeahead and Typeahead that was in the DefinitelyTyped types for the v5 version was exactly the right way to do this and it would be great if that was reinstated. This would also ease the upgrade path for typescript projects.

I have put together a codesandbox example that shows the error:

https://codesandbox.io/s/pensive-antonelli-o84wbj?file=/src/index.tsx

In my project, I’m getting errors on the `labelKey` prop as well. I’m not sure why that’s not showing in my example.

### Expected Behavior

It shouldn’t be necessary to bypass the typing system on the `onChange` prop to get the code to build cleanly.

### Actual Behavior

I get this error:
```
Type 'Dispatch<SetStateAction<StateStat[]>>' is not assignable to type '(selected: Option[]) => void'.
  Types of parameters 'value' and 'selected' are incompatible.
    Type 'Option[]' is not assignable to type 'SetStateAction<StateStat[]>'.
      Type 'Option[]' is not assignable to type 'StateStat[]'.
        Type 'Option' is not assignable to type 'StateStat'.
          Type 'string' is not assignable to type 'StateStat'.ts(2322)
```

comment.body:
> Is it worth contacting the people who did the DefinitelyTyped definitions? They did a really great job there

I've taken a look at the DT types and while they did do a nice job, one of the key differences is that they're only declaring types for the public API. To truly type this library in a comprehensive way, I'd also need to propagate types (specifically option generics) throughout the private API, which is significant.

I'm definitely open to ideas for how to provide type flexibility without significantly impacting the maintainability of the library.

issue.title: Support Multiple Datasets
issue.body:
Hello there, first of all thanks for your effort into writing react-bootstrap-typeahead.

I'm assigned a task at work to migrate a search component that uses the original jQuery based typeahead to react-bootstrap-typeahead. This search component queries multiple datasets. When the user types on the input, it queries different services and, if there are results, shows then grouped:

![multiple results](https://i.stack.imgur.com/FeSns.png)

(in this example, user typed "b", and there are results both from Addresses and Previous Results data sources)

The generated HTML by original typeahead in this example is as follows:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/397851/194612591-c41d2bbc-d6dc-46b1-a4db-55acc150a5f8.png)

Notice other databases were queried but their result is empty.

Something like this is not possible like this at this moment, right? I'm thinking of an ugly workaround (i.e. making multiple queries on `handleSearch`, concatenate the results and inserting fake, dummy elements to create the titles) but I'm not sure that this would be the best approach.

issue.title: Support Multiple Datasets
issue.body:
Hello there, first of all thanks for your effort into writing react-bootstrap-typeahead.

I'm assigned a task at work to migrate a search component that uses the original jQuery based typeahead to react-bootstrap-typeahead. This search component queries multiple datasets. When the user types on the input, it queries different services and, if there are results, shows then grouped:

![multiple results](https://i.stack.imgur.com/FeSns.png)

(in this example, user typed "b", and there are results both from Addresses and Previous Results data sources)

The generated HTML by original typeahead in this example is as follows:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/397851/194612591-c41d2bbc-d6dc-46b1-a4db-55acc150a5f8.png)

Notice other databases were queried but their result is empty.

Something like this is not possible like this at this moment, right? I'm thinking of an ugly workaround (i.e. making multiple queries on `handleSearch`, concatenate the results and inserting fake, dummy elements to create the titles) but I'm not sure that this would be the best approach.

comment.body:
Hey @nighto, thanks for opening this issue. I've [answered your question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/73990255/multiple-datasets-grouping-with-react-bootstrap-typeahead) about grouping the results over on StackOverflow.

As far as handling multiple datasets, it's entirely possible. The typeahead component doesn't care where data comes from, as long as it's ultimately passed in as a single array to the `options` prop. You could query multiple sources from `onSearch`, like a local cache as well as a remote endpoint.

issue.title: Confirmation of the choice on the tablet
issue.body:
On the keyboard, you can type a value in the input field. And if it starts to match the desired value, you can confirm the selection by pressing the "right-arrow" key.

Isn't there a similar action for quick selection for a mobile device? Thanks

issue.title: Confirmation of the choice on the tablet
issue.body:
On the keyboard, you can type a value in the input field. And if it starts to match the desired value, you can confirm the selection by pressing the "right-arrow" key.

Isn't there a similar action for quick selection for a mobile device? Thanks

comment.body:
> a similar action for quick selection for a mobile device?

You can use the [`selectHint` prop](https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/blob/main/docs/Upgrading.md#shouldselecthint-replaced-by-top-level-selecthint) to customize the hint selection behavior.

> is there an automatic selection option, if you paste into a field from the clipboard and there is one matching value in the list?

You can probably add an `onPaste` handler directly to the input and check the value against the options being passed to the typeahead. If one of the matches you can set the selection in state and pass the value to the `selected` prop.

I believe this is a duplicate of #704.

You should be able to type the argument of `onChange` to get around this:

```tsx
<Typeahead
  ...

/>
```

issue.title: AsyncTypeahead and searchText programatically
AsyncTypeahead and searchText programatically

comment.body:
The async functionality is primarily meant to work with user input, since it debounces the input. It seems like you should be able to trigger your search function using `onMenuToggle` as you're doing. You can pass a different string to the `emptyLabel` prop to indicate that the request is in progress.

You may want to consider looking at the [async behavior](https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/blob/main/src/behaviors/async.tsx) and writing your own version, since it sounds like you have some specific use cases you're trying to address.

issue.title: Support Bootstrap 5
issue.body:
[Bootstrap 5](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/getting-started/introduction/) is currently in beta, so I'm creating this issue to track the changes this library will need to make to support the new version out of the box. Please comment if you come across anything not working.

- [x] Update `ClearButton` classname to include `btn-close` ([BS5 Close Button component](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/components/close-button/))
- [x] Rename `sr-only` classname to `visually-hidden` ([Helpers](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/migration/#helpers))
- [x] Support [floating labels](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/forms/floating-labels/)

As a general workaround, the typeahead's [render props](https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/blob/master/docs/Rendering.md) and [child render function](https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/blob/master/docs/API.md#children) can be used to customize individual components in a way that better supports BS5.

release.name: v6.0.0
release.body:
### Breaking Changes

Please see the [migration guide](https://github.com/ericgio/react-bootstrap-typeahead/blob/master/docs/Upgrading.md#v60-breaking-changes) for more details on breaking changes and how to upgrade from v5 to v6.

- Drop support for IE11
- Upgrade react-popper/popperjs to v2 (#549)
- Don't allow refs to be passed via `inputProps`
- Introduced `selectHint` as a top-level prop; removed `shouldSelectHint` from lower-level components.
- Remove `selectHintOnEnter` prop
- Remove `asyncContainer`, `menutItemContainer`, and `tokenContainer` functions
- Removed `'large'` and `'small'` as valid values from the `size` prop

### Feature Requests
- Convert library to Typescript (#619)
- Support Bootstrap 5
- Allow better control of multi-select placeholder (#684)

### Bug Fixes
- Fix aux controls overlapping with validation (#658)
- Strip diacritics from non-latin alphabets (#659, #660)
- Only fire `onFocus` event once (#665)
- Trigger change handler when clicking clear button in multi-select mode (#666, #672)
- Get rid of console warnings in examples
- Ignore helper file from test coverage
- Fix act warnings in tests
- Don't pass option object to token
- Fix click forwarding on multi-select input (#695)
- Fix filter callback return type (#702) (Thanks @povder!)
- Remove @emotion/core types after running yarn (#705) (Thanks @DASPRiD!)
- Fix bug when filtering with `labelKey` function (#714)
- Fix multi-input disabled styles (#718)
- Copy font-weight to hintNode (#719)
- Upgrade react-overlays (#717, #721) (Thanks @charlesroelli!)

### Internal + Documentation
- Replace Travis w/Github Actions
- Use Prettier
- Incorporate Storybook and add Chromatic integration
- Upgrade dependencies
- Use `key` instead of `keyCode` for keyboard events
- Convert `Highlighter` to function component
- Add instructions for BS5 CSS
- Added breaking changes to the migration guide
- Added Storybook stories for each component
- Updated Jest config/setup
- Use rem for CSS
- Convert `withClassNames` HoC to a simple function
- Use `sass.compile` instead of `sass.render`
- Remove rollup-plugin-size-snapshot
- Use PrismJS as a module
- Add invariant types
- Convert examples to TS
- Add example for keeping the menu open during multi-selection

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for using react-bootstrap-typeahead and for reporting an issue! To submit a bug report, please fill out the template below. Better yet, submit a pull request that introduces a failing test due to the bug :)

Do not simply delete this template or your issue will be closed. Issues without required information will be closed.

Usage questions
======================
Unless you believe you've encountered a bug or want to request a feature, the issue tracker isn't the right place for getting help with your code. This format is not well-suited for Q&A, and questions here don't have as much visibility as they do elsewhere. Before you ask a question, here are some resources to get help first:

- Look for/ask questions on StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=react-bootstrap-typeahead
-->
### Version
v6.0.0-rc3

<!-- Be sure to double-check your installed version, as it may differ from the version listed in your package.json -->

### Steps to reproduce

<!--
Please provide DETAILED steps or better yet, a minimal repro case. If I can't reproduce the problem based on the information you provide, your issue will be closed.

Starter sandbox: https://codesandbox.io/s/9jq9jyzmry
-->
In version v5 I was able to import `defaultFilterBy` method from the library with
```
import { defaultFilterBy } from "react-bootstrap-typeahead/lib/utils"
```
To create a wrapped version of it and minimize code repetition e.g.
```
export function filterByCer(option, props) {
  const text = someTextNormalization(props.text)
  const _props = {
    ...props,
    ...{
      filterBy: [props.labelKey],
      text: text
    }
  }
  return defaultFilterBy(option, _props)
}
```
Starting from v6 this method is not exported anymore forcing me to copy the logic

### Expected Behavior

<!-- Describe what you would have expected. -->
Being able to import `defaultFilterBy`

### Actual Behavior

<!-- Describe what went wrong. -->

comment.body:
The `lib/` directory was renamed to `cjs/` in v6.0.0-alpha.3, so you can still access `defaultFilterBy` from 

```tsx
import { defaultFilterBy } from "react-bootstrap-typeahead/cjs/utils"
```
or
```tsx
import { defaultFilterBy } from "react-bootstrap-typeahead/es/utils"
```

Note that `defaultFilterBy` is not a top-level export of the library and should be considered private. It's therefore probably better that you do copy the functionality into your own codebase.

comment.body: @saivivek116 that's right, using the `clear` method won't work for multi-select instances since it will clear the selections as well as the text. Unfortunately, there's also no API for controlling the input's value (#266). One workaround would be to save the selections using state, and update the typeahead's react key on blur. This would maintain the selections but cause the component to unmount and remount, clearing the text.

comment.body: Hi @architdutt, and thanks for the feature request! The highlighting you refer to happens within the `Highlighter` component included in this library. That component currently doesn't provide a way to limit the substring match to the beginning of the string, but it should be pretty easy to [create your own component](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29652862/highlight-text-using-reactjs). Once you've done that, you can use `renderMenu` or `renderMenuItemChildren` to render the menu items using your component.
